result.execSummary:
The defendant Paul Martin Allen III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Paul Martin Allen III is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Paul Martin Allen III was found guilty of Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
***AMENDED***
Per Judge Eric J. Lundell February 24, 2016 - amend JOC to add conditional jail time.


***AMENDED***
Per Judge Eric J. Lundell May 21, 2015 - amend Count 1 in 14CF448 to 1 year probation.


Concurrent.
Court dismisses Counts 2 through 6.
Defendant to report to Probation Monday April 13, 2015.
Bond continues until Defendant reports to probation.
Defendant is eligible for expungement upon successful completion of probation but must petition the Court.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with:

-Domestic Abuse Assessment and follow through with any recommendations.
-Remain fully employed or full-time schooling.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-No Contact whatsoever with Mackenzie Gerard.
-Obtain GED or HSED.
-If requested by Victim or Victim's family, must participate in Victim Impact Panel through Restorative Justice Program.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

timeConds.notes: Condtion time, sentence to commence February 24, 2016.

supervisions.notes: Court costs and restitution to be converted into a civil judgment.

records.addlTxt: DE called to inquire about making pymt.  DE was advised that the Court will send him a new Pymt Plan in 4 mos & he must be sure to keep the court updated with his address in writing at all times while he's carrying a bal to ensure he receives his mail as the PO will not fwd Gov't mail.  DE verified the address currently on file.  I advised him I will be mailing a Pymt Plan in 4 mos & no pymts are due to the Court at this time. jaf

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Erica Ellenwood DF ATTY: Alex Andrea DF: Paul Martin Allen appeared from jail. Case called at 8:37. Includes 17CM449 (plea hearing) 14CF448 (PayH). Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads  G to Ct  1 removing the repeater in 17CM449. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1  in 17CM449 removing the repeater. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses the repeater in Ct 1 and Ct 2 in 17CM449. Sentencing arguments. DE makes statement. Crt orders: Sentence W/H
1 year probation concurrent to St. Croix County case 14CF203 with conditions:
- DE to have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Allison J.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.
- Domestic violence assessment and recommended follow through. 
- Costs of $243.00
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge of $200.00.
- Domestic violence surcharge.
  to be paid during probation. 
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all timesThis prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. 
- AODA and ecommended follow through. 
- Random and regular testing. 
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.

Court vacates bond, DE eligible for release today.
Court notes 57 days credit against ultimate sentence. 
DE to sign up for probation today. 

On 14CF448,  set for internal review for 4 months to notify DE of a payment plan.
Plea hearing on August 28, 2017 at 08:30 am.

To the DE denying his request for no good cause and age and balances due on the cases.  DEmailed a copy to the address on file on this date.  Includes 10JO20, 12FO453, 14CF448. jaf

**DE did not provide a mailing address on his request & upon my attempt to call the only phone # on file, DE's father answered & disconnected the call before Clerk was able to relay a msg.  jaf

Clerk called the DE at the # on file, but appears that the number is for the DE's father.  DE's father inquired about what the phone call was regarding & upon attempting to respond, he stated he could not hear and that he was at work then disconnected the call.  Clerk does not have any other phone # on file for the DE nor did he provide one or a mailing address w/his request.  Request is DENIED for no just cause to defer the Pymt Plan to pay off other bills.  Includes 10JO20, 12FO453, 14CF448. jaf

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Webb, Kasondra Moll appears from the DOC, DF: Paul Martin Allen appeared from jail, pro se.  Court called at 2:37 p.m.  Set for a probation review hearing.   Ms. Moll is asking for 30 days conditional jail time beginning today 02/24/2016.  Court questions the DE.  DE will proceed forward today without counsel.  DE does not disagree that he was out of touch with his probation agent.  DE had warrants in Hennepin and Washington County.  Court amends the DE's JOC to sentence the DE to 30 days conditional jail time to begin today 02/24/16.  DE makes statement.  Court adjourned.  lw

TO ALSO INCLUDE 14CF203,14CF399 and 14CF448:
  CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Liddle ,ADA: Kevin Gehler   DF ATTY:  Shirlene Renee Perrin   DF:  Paul Martin Allen appeared. Case called at 4:14 p.m.      Defendant is fine with Judge Lundell hearing case and so is parent and attorney. ADA Gehler gives recommendations. Victim is not present but has been notified and Victim Statement completed. Eligible for expungment upon successful completion of probation.  Atty Perrin in agreement with the recommendations. Court reads charge and maximum penalties and rights. DE pleads GUILTY to Ct 1 in 14CF203 . DE pleads GUILTY to Ct 1 amended to Misd. Battery in 14CF448.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 in 14CF203. Finds DE guilty of amended Ct 1 Misd. Battery in 14CF448. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 2 in 14CF203, both counts in 14CF399 and dismisses counts 2-6 in 14CF448 . Jessica from Victim Witness recites Victim's Impact Statement. Statement read by victim's father. ADA Gehler makes statement. Atty Perrin makes statement. Court recesses at 5:00 p.m. Case recalled at 5:02 p.m. 
Crt orders:
14CF203-Count 1-Possess with Intent and 14CF448 Ct 1 amended charge of Misd. Battery
- S/W 2years probation concurrent with 14CF203. Sign up for probation Monday April 13, 2015. Bond continues until reports to probation
- Domestic Abuse assessment and follow through with any recommendations
- Restitution in the amount of $599.68. Can set up payment plan
- Court costs total $443 for 14CF448 and 14CF203 $518.00. Can set up payment plan
- Remain fully employed or full time schooling
-  Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-  It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Mackenzie Gerard.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.
- Obtain GED or HSED
- Ordered to complete an alcohol assessment
- Can apply for expungment upon successful completion of probation
- If requested by Victim or Victim's family, must complete Victim Impact Panel through Restorative Justice Program
Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
Filed by Atty Perrin. Requesting a continuance. km

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

  It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Mackenzie Gerads and John Forseth.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Curfew is 11:30 p.m. to 8:00 a.m.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
